1.description: A tall young man from Emond's Field, Two Rivers. Has unusual grey eyes and reddish hair. Shepherd and farmer's son.

8.description: Can channel the One Power. Discovered he can sense when others can channel and has strange reactions to the Power.

51.description: The Dragon Reborn, prophesied savior and destroyer. Faced Ba'alzamon at the Eye of the World.

1.description: A young man from Emond's Field, known for his mischievous nature and pranks. Quick-witted and clever.

8.description: Carries a Shadar Logoth dagger that is slowly corrupting him. Shows signs of evil influence and paranoia.

20.description: Partially healed from the dagger's influence by Moiraine, but still connected to it. Shows unusual luck.

1.description: A large, strong young man from Emond's Field. Works as a blacksmith's apprentice. Thoughtful and careful.

23.description: Can communicate with wolves and has enhanced senses. His eyes have turned golden yellow.

1.description: The innkeeper's daughter from Emond's Field. Strong-willed and determined. Has feelings for Rand.

8.description: Can channel the One Power and learns to embrace saidar. Shows natural talent for channeling.

11.description: The Wisdom of Emond's Field, youngest ever. Skilled healer and herbalist. Very protective of her people.

relationships.Charges: Rand al'Thor, Mat Cauthon, Perrin Aybara, Egwene al'Vere

20.description: Can channel the One Power but only when angry. Has incredible strength in the Power when she can touch it.

2.description: An Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Small woman with dark hair and eyes. Seeks the Dragon Reborn.

8.description: From Cairhien nobility, House Damodred. Has been searching for the Dragon Reborn for twenty years.

2.description: Moiraine's Warder. A tall, hard man with cold blue eyes. Master swordsman and warrior.

12.description: Last king of Malkier, a Borderland nation destroyed by the Blight. Dedicated his life to fighting the Shadow.

4.description: A gleeman with a white mustache and patch-covered cloak. Entertainer and storyteller.

11.description: Former court bard and lover of Queen Morgase. Left the court under mysterious circumstances.

42.description: Reveals he can throw knives with deadly accuracy. Has been protecting the boys throughout their journey.

9.description: A figure of shadow and flame who appears in dreams. Claims to be the Dark One himself.

51.description: One of the Forsaken, not the Dark One. Seeks to turn or destroy the Dragon Reborn.

1.description: Rand's father, a sheep farmer and shepherd. Quiet, thoughtful man who rarely speaks of his past.

3.description: Former soldier and blademaster, carries a heron-marked sword. Fought in many wars before settling in Two Rivers.

1.description: A traveling peddler who visits Emond's Field regularly. Brings news and goods from outside.

47.description: A Darkfriend who was transformed by the Dark One to hunt the Dragon Reborn. Can track the three ta'veren.

relationships.Quarry: Rand al'Thor, Mat Cauthon, Perrin Aybara

1.description: The village blacksmith of Emond's Field. Perrin's master. Large, strong man with graying hair.
Master Luhhan's wife. Known for her strong opinions and no-nonsense attitude.
The Mayor of Emond's Field and innkeeper of the Winespring Inn. Egwene's father.
Bran's wife and Egwene's mother. Helps run the Winespring Inn.
Mat's father, a horse trader and farmer. Member of the Village Council.
Mat's mother, known for her cooking and strong will.
Perrin's father, a blacksmith. Quiet man like his son.
Perrin's mother, a gentle woman.
A member of the Village Council, known for being argumentative and pessimistic.
A miller and member of the Village Council.
A member of the Village Council.
Village drunk and troublemaker.
Bili Congar's wife, member of the Women's Circle.
One of Bili Congar's sons.
A young boy from Emond's Field, eager and curious about strangers.
One of the Coplin family, known troublemakers in the village.
Another member of the Coplin family.
A farmer from Emond's Field.
A farmer who reported strange events before Winternight.

3.description: Tam's deceased wife and Rand's mother. Died when Rand was young.

5.description: Innkeeper at The Stag and Lion in Baerlon.

15.description: A young woman who works at The Stag and Lion. Dresses like a boy and can see glimpses of the future around people.

42.description: Her viewings show her images that predict the future. Sees a heron-marked sword and other omens around Rand.

30.description: Lord Captain of the Children of the Light. A stern man who genuinely believes in the Light.
Son of Lord Captain Bornhald. Young officer in the Children of the Light.
A Child of the Light, fanatically devoted to the cause. Gaunt and harsh in appearance.

23.description: A man who can communicate with wolves. Former Warder who ran from his Aes Sedai when his ability manifested.
A female wolf, leader of her pack. Wise and cautious.
A male wolf in Dapple's pack. Fast and eager.
A male wolf in Dapple's pack. Young and impulsive.

25.description: Seeker of a band of Tuatha'an (Tinkers). Peaceful people who search for the song that was lost.
Raen's wife, a Tinker woman. Kind and caring, follows the Way of the Leaf.
A young Tinker man, Ila's grandson. Attracted to Egwene and shows interest in violence despite Tinker ways.

40.description: Queen of Andor, a beautiful woman with red-gold hair. Mother to Elayne and Gawyn.
Daughter-Heir of Andor, a beautiful young woman with red-gold curls. Can channel the One Power.
Son of Queen Morgase, brother to Elayne. Training to be Elayne's First Prince of the Sword.
Stepson of Queen Morgase, half-brother to Elayne and Gawyn. Incredibly handsome and believes in absolute right and wrong.
Captain-General of the Queen's Guards. A great military commander and loyal servant of Andor.
An Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, advisor to Queen Morgase. Has the Foretelling ability.
A false Dragon who was gentled by the Aes Sedai. Being brought to Tar Valon for display.

35.description: Innkeeper of The Queen's Blessing in Caemlyn. Fat, balding man who is loyal to Queen Morgase.
One of Master Gill's workers at The Queen's Blessing.

17.description: A farmer who gives Rand and Mat a ride in his cart to Four Kings.
Master Grinwell's daughter, a young woman who flirts with Rand and Mat.

32.description: Innkeeper at The Dancing Cartman in Four Kings. A Darkfriend who tries to capture Rand and Mat.

33.description: Innkeeper at The Goose and Crown. Another Darkfriend who recognizes Rand and Mat.

20.description: Captain of the riverboat Spray. A gruff Illianer sea captain who collects old things.

relationships.Passengers: Rand al'Thor, Mat Cauthon, Thom Merrilin

24.description: Possesses several items of the One Power, including a cuendillar seal from the Dark One's prison.

20.description: A crew member on Domon's ship. Lazy and untrustworthy sailor.
A crew member on Domon's ship.

46.description: Lord of Fal Dara keep in Shienar. A great military commander who holds the Borderlands against the Blight.
Lord Agelmar's sister, chatellaine of Fal Dara. A strong woman who can channel weakly.
A Shienaran lord and warrior. Captain under Lord Agelmar.
A Shienaran soldier with one eye and a foul mouth. Loyal warrior who serves Lord Agelmar.
A Shienaran soldier, fanatically devoted to duty and the Light.
A Shienaran soldier serving under Lord Agelmar.

loial.name: Loial
aliases: Loial son of Arent son of Halan

36.description: An Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. Ten feet tall with tufted ears and eyebrows. Loves books and trees.

43.description: Agrees to guide the group to the Eye of the World through the Ways. Expert on the Ways and Waygates.

relationships.Mission: Guide to Eye of the World

52.description: One of the Forsaken, freed from his prison near the Eye of the World. Creator of Trollocs and other Shadowspawn.
One of the Forsaken, freed with Aginor. Wears a black mask to hide his decayed face.

50.description: The last of the Nym, creatures made in the Age of Legends. Guardian of the Eye of the World.

relationships.Duty: Guarding the Eye of the World

19.description: An ancient evil spirit trapped in Shadar Logoth. Counselor who corrupted Aridhol into hatred.

1.description: The Dragon from the Age of Legends who broke the world. Went mad from the taint on saidin.

51.description: The true identity of Ba'alzamon. First and strongest of the Forsaken, never fully sealed.

2.description: Lan's warhorse, a black stallion trained for battle. The name means 'Blade' in the Old Tongue.
Moiraine's white mare. The name means 'Westwind' in the Old Tongue.

1.description: Egwene's shaggy brown mare. A sturdy, reliable horse.
One of Mat's younger sisters. Known for being mischievous like her brother.
Another of Mat's younger sisters.
Egwene's younger sister. Helps at the Winespring Inn.
Another of Egwene's younger sisters.
One of Perrin's younger sisters.
Another of Perrin's younger sisters.
Perrin's youngest sibling.
Member of the Village Council. A farmer from Emond's Field.

A villager from Emond's Field.
One of the village boys, similar in age to Rand, Mat, and Perrin.

Son of Samel Crawe. One of the village boys.
Son of Flann Lewin. One of the village boys.

A serving girl at The Stag and Lion inn in Baerlon.

A guardsman in the Queen's Guards.

A worker at The Queen's Blessing inn in Caemlyn.

46.description: A Shienaran soldier serving at Fal Dara.
A Shienaran soldier at Fal Dara.
A Shienaran soldier serving under Lord Agelmar.
A Shienaran soldier at Fal Dara keep.

32.description: A Darkfriend in Four Kings who recognizes Rand and Mat. Works with other local Darkfriends.

30.description: A Child of the Light in Bornhald's legion.
Another Child of the Light serving under Bornhald.

25.description: A Tuatha'an Seeker mentioned by Raen. Previous leader of their band.

36.description: Loial's mother, an Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. Mentioned when Loial speaks of his home.
Loial's father, an Ogier. Referenced in Loial's full name.
Loial's grandfather, an Ogier. Referenced in Loial's full name.

23.description: The Aes Sedai that Elyas served as Warder before his wolf abilities manifested.

1.description: Lews Therin's beloved wife from the Age of Legends, killed by him in his madness.
An Aes Sedai from the Age of Legends, opposed Lews Therin's plan to seal the Dark One.

19.description: The deadly mist that inhabits Shadar Logoth, born from the city's concentrated hate and suspicion.

11.description: Thom's nephew, a young man who could channel. Was gentled by the Aes Sedai and died.

1.description: Rand's horse, a bay stallion. Steady and reliable mount.
An elderly farmer from Watch Hill area of the Two Rivers.

40.description: A lord in Queen Morgase's court. Mentioned among the Andoran nobility.

13.description: The governing official of the town of Baerlon. Mentioned in passing.

2.description: A Trolloc that spoke to Rand during the attack on Winternight. Unusual for Trollocs to speak coherently.

1.description: A creature of the Shadow with no eyes but perfect vision. Commands Trollocs in the attack on Emond's Field.
Large ravens that serve as spies for the Shadow. Appear before the Trolloc attack.
Father of Hu Marwin. A villager in Emond's Field.
Another member of the Congar family.
Another miller, possibly related to Jon Thane.

Another son of Master al'Dai.
A villager from Emond's Field.
A member of the Lewin family.
A villager from Emond's Field.

An ancient banner found at the Eye of the World, bearing the symbol of the Dragon.

aliases: Seal on the Dark One's prison

53.description: One of the seven seals on the Dark One's prison, found broken at the Eye of the World.

13.description: A farmer from near Baerlon who gives the group information.

1.description: A member of the Aybara family, possibly related to Perrin.

4.description: Legendary High King who united all lands under his rule. Died nearly a thousand years ago.
A hero of legend, mentioned in stories. Said to be one of the Heroes of the Horn.
A legendary archer and hero, companion to Gaidal Cain in the stories.
A legendary hero mentioned in stories told by gleemen.
Another legendary hero mentioned in gleeman tales.
A famous traveler and hero, known for exploring distant lands.

13.description: King of Tear, mentioned in news and rumors.
The leader of all Aes Sedai, mentioned in discussions about Aes Sedai politics.

3.description: Referenced in Tam's fever dreams as a woman who died giving birth on Dragonmount during the Aiel War.
The king whose actions sparked the Aiel War. Mentioned in Tam's memories.

19.description: The deadly mist that inhabits Shadar Logoth, born from the city's concentrated hate and suspicion.

30.description: The leader of the Children of the Light, mentioned by the Whitecloaks.

11.description: Thom's sister, Owyn's mother. Died of grief after her son was gentled.

40.description: Morgase's deceased husband, father of Galad. From House Damodred.

44.description: An Aes Sedai mentioned in connection with Logain's capture.
A Red Sister mentioned with Logain's procession.

50.description: Various creatures corrupted by the Blight, including worms, twisted plants, and predators.

3.description: Various Aiel warriors from different societies encountered in war stories and memories.

42.description: Various guards, servants, and staff working in the royal palace.

Merchants from various nations encountered throughout the journey.

32.description: Innkeepers along the Caemlyn Road, some of whom serve the Shadow.
Various people who have sworn to serve the Dark One, found throughout the land.

23.description: Various wolves encountered who can communicate through the wolf network.

25.description: Various members of the Traveling People encountered in Raen's band.

30.description: Various soldiers and officers in the military order serving under Bornhald.

46.description: Various soldiers and officers defending the Borderlands at Fal Dara.

20.description: Various sailors, captains, and workers encountered during river travel.

17.description: Various people encountered traveling the roads between towns and cities.

1.description: Various residents of Emond's Field and surrounding areas not individually named.
The force of Light and creation, opposite to the Dark One. Creator of the Wheel of Time.
The source of all evil, imprisoned outside the Pattern but seeking to break free and remake reality.
The cosmic force that turns the Pattern and weaves the threads of existence through time.
The fabric of reality itself, woven by the Wheel of Time. Influences ta'veren and shapes destiny.

43.description: A deadly entity that inhabits the Ways, hunting travelers with whispers and madness.

40.description: Tigraine's brother, former Prince of Andor who disappeared into the Blight.

12.description: A lord who betrayed Malkier to the Shadow, leading to its fall.

36.description: Ogier with the talent to sing to trees and help them grow, mentioned by Loial.

21.description: A captain of the Atha'an Miere mentioned in river trade discussions.

13.description: A merchant from Arad Doman encountered in Baerlon.

35.description: A merchant from Tear encountered in Caemlyn.
A merchant from Illian with distinctive accent encountered in Caemlyn.

13.description: The ruler of Ghealdan, mentioned in passing political news.
The ruler of Saldaea, mentioned in news from the Borderlands.

46.description: The ruler of Shienar, whose authority Agelmar serves under.

44.description: Guards serving in Tar Valon, mentioned with Logain's escort.
The Amyrlin Seat's chief aide, mentioned in Aes Sedai discussions.

43.description: Ogier responsible for maintaining and guarding the Waygates.

4.description: A people from across the Aryth Ocean, mentioned briefly in stories and legends.

recaps.1: Ravens attack Emond's Field on Winternight. Rand sees a cloaked figure watching him. Trollocs attack the village, destroying homes and killing villagers. Tam is wounded and speaks of finding Rand as a baby.
recaps.2: Moiraine, an Aes Sedai, and her Warder Lan arrive in Emond's Field. They help heal Tam and reveal that Rand, Mat, and Perrin are being hunted by the Dark One's forces.
recaps.3: Tam reveals to Rand that he found him as a baby during the Aiel War. Rand learns he was adopted. The village prepares to defend against more Trolloc attacks.
recaps.4: The group flees Emond's Field with Moiraine and Lan. Thom Merrilin, a gleeman, joins them. They travel toward Baerlon to escape the Trollocs hunting them.
recaps.5: The group reaches Baerlon and stays at The Stag and Lion inn. They must hide their identities while Moiraine gathers information about the pursuit.
recaps.6: In Baerlon, the group learns more about the dangers following them. Nynaeve arrives, having tracked them from Emond's Field.
recaps.7: Nynaeve confronts Moiraine about taking the young people away. The group prepares to leave Baerlon as danger approaches.
recaps.8: The group flees Baerlon by night. Mat begins showing signs of evil influence from touching something in Shadar Logoth. The party splits up when attacked.
recaps.9: Separated from the others, Rand experiences strange dreams of Ba'alzamon. The Dark One's lieutenant tries to turn him to the Shadow.
recaps.10: Still separated, the group members struggle to survive on their own while being hunted by Darkfriends and worse creatures.
recaps.11: Nynaeve tracks down some of the group members. Her abilities as the Wisdom help her find them using her special talents.
recaps.12: The group learns more about Lan's background as the uncrowned king of fallen Malkier. His dedication to fighting the Shadow is revealed.
recaps.13: Moiraine explains more about the One Power and the dangers facing them. The corruption of the Source affects male channelers.
recaps.14: Ba'alzamon appears again in dreams, showing his power and trying to corrupt the ta'veren. The pull of the Pattern affects their journey.
recaps.15: In Caemlyn, Min Farshaw sees visions around the group members, particularly Rand, showing glimpses of their possible futures.
recaps.16: The group continues their journey, facing various dangers and challenges. The influence of being ta'veren becomes more apparent.
recaps.17: Rand and Mat travel together, taking rides with farmers. They encounter Darkfriends who recognize them despite their disguises.
recaps.18: The boys continue toward Caemlyn, facing hunger and suspicion. Their luck seems to both help and hinder them.
recaps.19: In the abandoned city of Shadar Logoth, Mat takes a dagger cursed with ancient evil. This begins his corruption by the city's malevolent power.
recaps.20: Captain Domon gives passage on his riverboat. Mat's condition worsens from the dagger's influence, showing increased paranoia and aggression.
recaps.21: Travel by river continues as Mat becomes more affected by the Shadar Logoth dagger. The corruption spreads through his system.
recaps.22: The river journey faces various dangers including pursuit by enemies. Mat's paranoia increases as the dagger's evil takes hold.
recaps.23: Perrin and Egwene meet Elyas, who can communicate with wolves. Perrin discovers he has the same ability, marking him as a wolfbrother.
recaps.24: Perrin learns to communicate with wolves, gaining enhanced senses but worrying about losing his humanity to the wolf nature.
recaps.25: The group encounters the Tuatha'an (Tinkers), peaceful travelers who follow the Way of the Leaf and search for a lost song.
recaps.26: Among the Tinkers, they learn about the philosophy of absolute pacifism. Aram shows interest in Egwene and violence despite his upbringing.
recaps.27: The stay with the Tinkers reveals different ways of life. The contrast between their peaceful ways and the violence pursuing the group is stark.
recaps.28: Leaving the Tinkers, Perrin and Egwene continue their journey with Elyas, constantly aware of the wolves tracking alongside them.
recaps.29: The wolf connection grows stronger for Perrin, bringing both enhanced abilities and fears about losing his human nature to the wolf.
recaps.30: The Children of the Light (Whitecloaks) capture Perrin and Egwene. These fanatic soldiers suspect them of being Darkfriends.
recaps.31: Under interrogation by the Whitecloaks, Perrin and Egwene face accusations of consorting with the Dark One through association with wolves.
recaps.32: The Whitecloak trial continues as Lord Captain Bornhald questions them. Byar is particularly suspicious and harsh in his treatment.
recaps.33: Escape attempts are planned as the situation with the Whitecloaks becomes more dangerous. Their prejudice against anything unusual shows clearly.
recaps.34: The rescue of Perrin and Egwene involves wolves attacking the Whitecloak camp. This reinforces their suspicions about Darkfriend associations.
recaps.35: Reunited with Moiraine and Lan, the group reaches Caemlyn. They stay at The Queen's Blessing inn while planning their next move.
recaps.36: In Caemlyn, they meet Loial, an Ogier who becomes fascinated with their quest. His knowledge of the Ways becomes crucial to their mission.
recaps.37: Loial explains the Ways, ancient roads between stedding that allow rapid travel. However, they have become dangerous over time.
recaps.38: Plans are made to use the Ways to reach their destination quickly. Loial's expertise will be essential for navigating the corrupted pathways.
recaps.39: Preparation for entering the Ways continues as the dangers and benefits are weighed. The group must decide if the risk is worth it.
recaps.40: Queen Morgase holds court in Caemlyn. The royal family is introduced, including Elayne, Gawyn, and Galad, along with various court officials.
recaps.41: Court intrigue in Caemlyn reveals the politics surrounding the Queen and her advisors. Elaida's role as Aes Sedai advisor is prominent.
recaps.42: Rand accidentally falls into the Palace gardens, meeting Elayne and Gawyn. This incident draws unwanted attention to the group.
recaps.43: The meeting with royalty creates complications for their mission. Rand's encounter with Elayne begins an important relationship.
recaps.44: Political tensions in Caemlyn affect the group's plans. The arrival of Logain, a false Dragon, creates additional turmoil in the city.
recaps.45: Logain's procession through the city demonstrates the power of Aes Sedai and the fate of men who can channel the corrupted Source.
recaps.46: The group travels to Fal Dara in Shienar, a Borderland keep that guards against the Blight. Lord Agelmar commands this crucial fortress.
recaps.47: At Fal Dara, they meet Shienaran warriors including Ingtar, Uno, and others. These soldiers are dedicated to fighting the Shadow.
recaps.48: Preparation for entering the Blight begins at Fal Dara. The group readies for the dangerous journey to the Eye of the World.
recaps.49: Final preparations are made as the group prepares to enter the Blight, the corrupt wasteland where the Dark One's influence is strongest.
recaps.50: The journey through the Blight reveals a wasteland of corruption and evil. They encounter various dangers on the way to the Eye.
recaps.51: At the Eye of the World, they meet the Green Man, last of the Nym. The pool of untainted saidin represents hope against the corruption.
recaps.52: Aginor and Balthamel, two of the Forsaken, attack at the Eye. The Green Man sacrifices himself to destroy Balthamel in the battle.
recaps.53: Rand channels saidin from the Eye and defeats Aginor and Ba'alzamon. The Horn of Valere and a seal from the Dark One's prison are found.
